info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 4 at 7:37PM CDT until July 5 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Furnas.
* WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly some rural county roads and along small creeks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of moderate to heavy rain within much of the Advisory area. Over the last few hours, a widespread 2 to 3 inches of rain have fallen, with up to roughly 1 inch of additional rain possible over the next few hours before rain mostly ends for the night. Minor flooding is likely ongoing or expected to begin shortly in parts of the Advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Muddy Creek, Elk Creek, Deer Creek, Beaver Creek and Timmons Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Arapahoe and Holbrook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT
